title: How to Speed Up Internet Explorer

steps.headline: Press the ⊞ Windows + R keys simultaneously.
Enter regedit and press enter to open the Windows Registry Editor.
Look for two values called MaxConnectionsPerServer and MaxConnectionsPer1_0Server.
steps.description: If not, then perform the following:

steps.headline: Double click on MaxConnectionsPerServer.
Make sure to select 'Decimal', instead of the default 'Hexadecimal' under Base.
steps.description: Change the value depending on your connection speed. If you use dial-up, set the value to 6. If you use DSL or faster, you may set a value from 10 to 16, as you desire.

steps.headline: Do the same as above for MaxConnectionsPer1_0Server.

text:
Press the ⊞ Windows + R keys simultaneously. Enter regedit and press enter to open the Windows Registry Editor. Navigate to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Internet Settings. Look for two values called MaxConnectionsPerServer and MaxConnectionsPer1_0Server. If not, then perform the following: Double click on MaxConnectionsPerServer. Right-click and select New > DWORD Value. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/31/Speed-Up-Internet-Explorer-Step-4Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Speed-Up-Internet-Explorer-Step-4Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/3/31/Speed-Up-Internet-Explorer-Step-4Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Create two DWORD Values named as above. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/99/Speed-Up-Internet-Explorer-Step-4Bullet3.jpg/v4-460px-Speed-Up-Internet-Explorer-Step-4Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/9/99/Speed-Up-Internet-Explorer-Step-4Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Double click on MaxConnectionsPerServer. Make sure to select 'Decimal', instead of the default 'Hexadecimal' under Base. Change the value depending on your connection speed. If you use dial-up, set the value to 6. If you use DSL or faster, you may set a value from 10 to 16, as you desire. Do the same as above for MaxConnectionsPer1_0Server. Close the Registry Editor. Restart Internet Explorer.
sentences: Press the ⊞ Windows + R keys simultaneously.
Enter regedit and press enter to open the Windows Registry Editor.
Look for two values called MaxConnectionsPerServer and MaxConnectionsPer1_0Server.
If not, then perform the following: Double click on MaxConnectionsPerServer.
Right-click and select New > DWORD Value.

\n<\/p><\/div>"} Double click on MaxConnectionsPerServer.
Make sure to select 'Decimal', instead of the default 'Hexadecimal' under Base.
Change the value depending on your connection speed.
If you use dial-up, set the value to 6.
If you use DSL or faster, you may set a value from 10 to 16, as you desire.
Do the same as above for MaxConnectionsPer1_0Server.
